SALESFORCE HELP

VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12)

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) introduces several improvements and enhancements, but doesn't introduce any disruptive changes that require manual action. To make sure that your org, Experience Cloud sites, and storefronts are updated with the latest security enhancements, complete the following upgrade steps.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Salesforce CompatibilitySalesforce not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.


B2B Commerce Compatibility

Any solution upgrading to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
TIP Before you begin, complete the steps in Prepare Your Existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce Data for Upgrade and ensure that you've resolved the prerequisites for upgrading the managed package.
To install B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), complete the steps in Upgrade the B2B Commerce for Visualforce Managed Package. Select the appropriate installation URL for your version and org type.
If your upgrade path includes other major versions, resolve disruptive changes introduced in those versions.
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ‘19 (Version 4.10)
Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
If you haven't already, verify that you've updated your org's sharing and security settings. Complete the steps in the following topics:
Update External Access Sharing Settings for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Custom Objects
Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure by Default
TIP If you've already resolved these security alerts for a previous version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, you can relax! No extra action is necessary after you upgrade the managed package.
Review the list of other fixes in this release, and complete any required upgrade steps.
Finally, determine your next steps:
If your upgrade path isn't complete and still includes B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), continue to Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13).
If you're not upgrading any further than B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12), review the information in Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12). For each patch that precedes the build you installed, complete any required upgrade steps.
TIP Yes, some patches contain fixes that require you to complete extra steps. Each patch release is also cumulative, and contains all the fixes from the same major version's previous patches. For example, let's say that you when you upgraded to Spring ’20 (version 4.12) from Summer ’19 (version 4.11), you installed build 3.147.3. Review the notes from all B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) patches that preceded 3.147.3, and complete any extra upgrade steps.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Upgrading B2B Commerce for Visualforce
